image.altText: A young woman with long brown hair

props.synopsis: Mother of three Synamin Bell was killed by her former partner Cody James Edwards in her Millicent home while he was in a drug-induced psychosis in 2022.

title.children: Family of SA mother killed by partner leaves court before perpetrator can deliver apology

image.altText: A man in agricultural attire leans on a tractor.

props.synopsis: Winter crop production is forecast to rise to near-record levels in parts of the country but farmers in others are hoping just to break even after battling unfavourable weather.

title.children: Crops flourish in eastern states while South Australia, Victoria face harvest slump

image.altText: 0.5x zoom image of Kure Medical Mildura sign on front of medical clinic, with a black vignette

props.synopsis: The practice of charging patients an annual membership fee to guarantee bulk-billed services is being described as a "rampant" form of breaching Medicare rules.Â

title.children: 'Double dipping' doctors are breaching bulk-billing rules by also charging patients, experts say

image.altText: A white whale calf in on the surface of the ocean.

props.synopsis: It's been an exceptional whale season off the coast of South Australia, where the return of southern rights after a mysterious absence last year is being celebrated by enthusiasts.

title.children: 'Magical' southern right whales return to SA coast with rare white calves in tow

image.altText: Bill Shorten looks stern as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: Bill Shorten never achieved his ultimate aim to become prime minister. But reflecting on his career in politics, the former Labor leader still counts himself lucky, and says what matters is "whether we leave the place better than we found it".

title.children: Bill Shorten offers one more zinger, as he prepares to leave politics

image.altText: A headshot of a man in a suit and tie, looking off to one side.

props.synopsis: Though his communication skills were acquired rather than innate, Shorten's departure will leave Labor bereft of one of its sharpest advocates.

title.children: Albanese's old rival Bill Shorten leaves a parting gift: A huge gap that's hard to fill

image.altText: Gardener Koren Helbig kneels beside a narrow garden bed where she is growing leafy greens and vegetables. She wears a purple top

props.synopsis: After much trial and error, I'm finally eating almost daily from my small urban veggie patch. Here are five strategies I follow.

title.children: How to grow a veggie patch you can eat from each week

image.altText: Side profiles of Vincent Tarzia and David Speirs shrouded in dark shadows

props.synopsis: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs has not held back in his assessment both of his successor's fledgling leadership and his party's chances at the next state election, saying there is a "level of shambolic-ness about what's going on".

title.children: 'Shambolic-ness' besets SA Liberal Party less than a month after new leader appointed, David Speirs says

image.altText: A woman in a purple top sits in front of a coloured wall.

props.synopsis: A suburb in Adelaide's north has pockets of intergenerational disadvantage but its community is working together to improve outcomes for local children.

title.children: Children can be on a specialist waitlist for months. This school is helping parents access care

image.altText: A composite image showing photos taken from CCTV vision.

props.synopsis: Explicit and uncensored CCTV vision of people having sex in a lift and urinating in public was turned into a video and played to hundreds of staff at a Merivale awards night.

title.children: Merivale played CCTV video of people having sex to hundreds of staff at company party

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: RBA governor Michele Bullock says more people are seeking help from community organisations as the economy slows down, but the fight against inflation must be won.

title.children: RBA governor warns some households may have to 'sell their homes' amid cost of living crisis

image.altText: The silhouette of a steel lattice gas tower at dusk with a flare at the top

props.synopsis: Australia is one of the world's biggest gas exporters, but we're about to start importing it from overseas.

title.children: Gas giant Australia prepares for the unthinkable: Importing supplies for the first time

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit standing in front of a staircase.

props.synopsis: ASIO boss Mike Burgess says he may soon use powers to compel tech companies to cooperate with warrants and unlock encrypted chats to aid national security investigations.

title.children: ASIO boss puts tech companies on notice regarding encrypted chats

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: A witness has told the South Australian Supreme Court that Steven Hainsworth tried to sell her items from an alleged victim's home, and allegedly made an admission to killing a man. Warning: This story contains graphic details.

title.children: Alleged serial killer stole and sold victim's belongings, court hears

image.altText: Sheep in a pen on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: Millions of sterile male blowflies will be bred at a world-first facility and released to mate with females in a trial aiming to end flystrike on the island.

title.children: Hopes painful pest costing sheep farmers millions could soon be eradicated on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Several police cars blocking a road on a semi-rural lane.

props.synopsis: A 14-year-old student has been charged with murder after four people were shot dead at a high school near Atlanta, Georgia.

title.children: 'An evil thing': 14-year-old charged with murder after four killed in US school shooting

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: The iconic King Island Dairy will close after more than 120 years of operations following dairy giant Saputo's failure to attract a buyer for the business.

title.children: King Island Dairy to shut, ending iconic Australian cheese brand

image.altText: A Palestinian security officer loyal to Hamas opens a gate to the Philadelphi corridor between Egypt and Gaza.

props.synopsis: A narrow strip of scrubland on the Gaza side of the border with Egypt has emerged as a major obstacle to ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas. But what's the significance of the so-called Philadelphi corridor?

title.children: How a narrow strip of land, the 'Philadelphi Corridor', has become an obstacle to a ceasefire in Gaza

image.altText: the nsw shadow minister for health matt kean looking at the camera as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: The Climate Change Authority says Australia has a decade to remove 75 per cent of its emissions if it wants to have any chance to keep global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius â and with such a mammoth task, it is keeping its mind open to nuclear.

title.children: Newly-appointed climate adviser Matt Kean tells government to keep open mind on nuclear

image.altText: A man speaking to a crowd of tradespeople

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says she has been informed appearances by former CFMEU secretary John Setka at Victorian worksites was unlawful. The matter has been referred to Victoria Police.

title.children: John Setka's appearances at Victorian construction sites referred to police

image.altText: GettyImages-2169547555

props.synopsis: While the athletes are the stars of the show, a group of unsung heroes are finally being recognised for their work at the Paralympics.

title.children: Tappers, tethers, and clappers â these are the unsung champions of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: A missile being launched in the desert, with smoke and fire left behind.

props.synopsis: As Moscow carries out some of the deadliest strikes on Ukraine this year, Kyiv is desperately seeking approval from the United States to use its long-range missile on high-value targets in Russia.

title.children: Ukraine says it can't stop Russia's barrage of deadly strikes without these missiles

image.altText: A composite image including a motorcycle, a man's silhouetted upper body, palm trees, methamphetamines and drug parcels.

props.synopsis: Former drug traffickers have revealed how they manipulated often under-resourced border controls and isolated ports and airports, to bring drugs into the Pacific.

title.children: Drug traffickers reveal 'easy' methods to import product into the Pacific, 'paying off' customs and airport staff

image.altText: A MÄori woman wearing a green plant crown and a feather necklace

props.synopsis: Kiingi Tuheitia Pootatau Te Wherowhero VII is laid to rest alongside generations of ancestors at Mount Taupiri after his funeral procession wraps up days of mourning.

title.children: After the death of the MÄori king, his youngest child and only daughter is crowned as the new monarch

image.altText: A family of three sitting in a loungeroom looking at the camera. The young son is holding a black chicken

props.synopsis: Contentious legislation paving the way for a shake-up of the NDIS recently passed parliament. But about a month out from changes starting to take effect, many participants remain in the dark about what it means for them.

title.children: Major NDIS changes are weeks away. Felicity's worried about what it means for her kids

image.altText: US Attorney General at a press conference in suit.

props.synopsis: A series of wire transfers worth millions of dollars to a conservative US media network disguised a web of Russian disinformation and propaganda.

title.children: A user's guide to how Russian media paid for US influencers to peddle disinformation

image.altText: A close up image of a man in a tie.

props.synopsis: Apart from the pandemic years, GDP hasn't been this weak since Jim Chalmers was at school and Oasis was getting together for the first time.

title.children: GDP has plunged and consumers are skipping the cafe. Without government spending things could be worse

image.altText: Photo of smiling man with black jumper and beard.

props.synopsis: A Perth man dies in hospital two weeks after spending 15 hours unconscious in a gym shower before being found.

title.children: Bodybuilder dies two weeks after being left unconscious in Perth gym shower for 15 hours

props.synopsis: Many parents suffer silently from lack of sleep, sometimes with devastating outcomes. Why is there so much conflicting information on baby sleep, and how can we support families to thrive?Â

title.children: It's OK, there's no normal: How to manage a new baby and survive sleep deprivation

image.altText: The pope lovingly holds the hand of an imam, with both dressed in white robes

props.synopsis: The 87-year-old leader of the Catholic church visits Indonesia's largest mosque, meeting with its grand imam in an encounter rich with symbolic meaning.

title.children: Pope joins grand imam of Indonesia in calling for climate change action for 'harmonious coexistence' of communities

image.altText: Michael De Campo, pictured in a room with bookshelves.

props.synopsis: Michael De Campo would prefer a quiet retirement, but that choice vanished â along with half his superannuation funds â in a suspected Ponzi scheme.

title.children: Michael thought he'd made a safe retirement investment, then the money stopped

image.altText: Huge tunneling infrastructure

props.synopsis: A hydrologist says the Snowy 2.0 pumped-hydro scheme will be more resilient to climate change than its predecessor but predicted extreme droughts will cause issues.

title.children: Snowy 2.0 may face drought challenges as government commits to water review

image.altText: A side profile of Alec Baldwin with a big camera to his side held by a camera man, Baldwin has thick glasses on, grey hair

props.synopsis: The actor's trial for involuntary manslaughter was dismissed in July after the judge ruled evidence had been withheld.

title.children: Prosecutors argue to reinstate Alec Baldwin's manslaughter charge

image.altText: Taylor Swift, Patrick Mahomes, Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders

props.synopsis: The NFL has become more than what happens on the field, with celebrity culture and intrigue becoming just as vital to the sport's popularity with fans as wins and losses. Here is your guide to the 2024 season.

title.children: From the Cowboys cheerleaders to the Chiefs making a run for history, the 2024 NFL season has everything a fan wants
